item.title: Employees in Singapore are seeking opportunities for career advancement and a positive work environment
item.description:
Source: CareerBuilder Singapore. The attributes of an Employer of Choice. A 2017 survey by CareerBuilder Singapore reveals that simply offering a competitive salary isn’t enough to attract and keep talented employees. The study, titled Employer of Choice Survey* 2017, showed that Singaporean workers prioritize strong career growth prospects and an inclusive work environment over financial compensation when selecting an ideal employer. item.title: Robert Half suggests diversifying incentives in order to retain talent
item.description:
A significant portion of Singapore’s workforce prioritizes work-life balance over higher salaries, according to a recent study. The Robert Half 2017 Salary Guide highlights that 69% of Singaporean employees are driven by more than just monetary compensation. The study reveals that nearly half (43%) would accept lower pay for flexible work hours, while over a third (37%) would choose the ability to work remotely over a pay raise. Non-financial benefits are highly valued by Singaporean workers, with 28% willing to trade a portion of their salary for increased medical benefits and 20% favoring more vacation time...
